stem: The nurse is conducting well-child assessments. For each developmental milestone, select the age(s) at which a child should normally be able to perform the task.

rationale.correct: Milestones occur in a predictable cephalocaudal and proximodistal pattern. (r1) Sitting unsupported is a 6-month milestone. (r2) Walking is a major 12-month milestone. (r3) Cooperative play (with others) emerges around 4 years (preschool); toddlers (2yr) engage in parallel play. (r4) Two-word phrases are the hallmark of 2-year-old language development.
rationale.incorrect: Toddlers (2yo) play *beside* each other (parallel), not *with* each other (cooperative).
clinicalPearls: Regression in milestones is a significant red flag requiring further neurological or developmental screening.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember: 2 years = Parallel (Next to each other). 4 years = Cooperative (With each other).

mnemonic.title: A-G-E
mnemonic.expansion: At 6 mo (Sit), At 12 mo (Walk), At 2 yrs (Talk 2 words), At 4 yrs (Play 4-gether/cooperative).

reviewUnits.heading: Pediatric Growth and Development
reviewUnits.body: Nurses use standardized tools like the Denver II for screening. Variations in 'normal' exist, but significant delays (e.g., not walking by 18 months) require intervention.
